intro: Siparuna subinodora, commonly known as the red-veined siparuna, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with prominent red veins. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in cymes, often followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
